columns.name: EAVE_LINKNO
columns.label: EAVE Study Identifier
columns.description: EAVE-II Identifier, pseudoynmised CHI numbers are used to create randomly assigned study index numbers.

columns.name: SampleID
columns.label: Sample ID
columns.description: Original Sample ID from the serology team

columns.name: age
columns.label: Age
columns.description: Age of the study given in years, extracted from the serology files - and shouldn't be well trusted

columns.name: sex
columns.label: Sex (number)
columns.description: Sex at birth - extracted from the serology files/team - it should not be trusted as being reliable

columns.name: isoweek
columns.label: Week Number
columns.description: Week number since the start of the pandemic

columns.name: year
columns.label: Year
columns.description: Year of the lookup file used to determine the Health Boards

columns.name: Sampledate_iso
columns.label: Sample Date
columns.description: The date the serology measurement was taken from the individual (in ISO format)

columns.name: hb
columns.label: Health Board
columns.description: The Scottish Health Board in which the individual was registered with

columns.name: assay
columns.label: Assay
columns.description: Antibody Assay machine was was used when measuring the blood serum sample for the presence of IgG antibodies to SARs-CoV-2

columns.name: test_result_qual
columns.label: Qualitative Test Result
columns.description: Qualitative test results from the assay for the presence (or lack thereof) of IgG to SARs-CoV-2. The assay defines the threshold that determines +ve or -ve tests.

columns.name: test_result_quant
columns.label: Quantative Test Result
columns.description: IgG measurements in Binding Activation Units [BAUs] that are measured by the assay. There are values that are truncated above/below certain values as the result was out-of-bounds of the assay's sensitivity for these.

columns.name: EAVE_LINKNO
columns.label: EAVE Study Identifier
columns.description: EAVE-II Identifier, pseudoynmised CHI numbers that were used to link this dataset

columns.name: ADMISSION_DATE
columns.label: Admission Date
columns.description: Date the study was admitted into hospital

columns.name: DISCHARGE_DATE
columns.label: Discharge Date
columns.description: Date the study was discharged from hospital

columns.name: MAIN_CONDITION
columns.label: Main Condition
columns.description: The reason the study was admitted into hospital (ICD10 code)

columns.name: OTHER_CONDITION_1
columns.description: Other reasons identified for hospital admission (ICD10 codes)

columns.name: OTHER_CONDITION_2
columns.description: Other reasons identified for hospital admission

columns.name: OTHER_CONDITION_3
columns.description: Other reasons identified for hospital admission

columns.name: OTHER_CONDITION_4
columns.description: Other reasons identified for hospital admission

columns.name: OTHER_CONDITION_5
columns.description: Other reasons identified for hospital admission

meta.extra: Key demographics file to rely on and look up information about a study (age, Sex,..)

columns.name: EAVE_LINKNO
columns.label: EAVE Study Identifier
columns.description: EAVE-II Identifier, pseudoynmised CHI numbers are used to create randomly assigned study index numbers.

columns.name: Sex
columns.label: Sex
columns.description: Sex at birth

columns.name: ageYear
columns.label: Age
columns.description: Age in years

columns.name: hb2019
columns.label: NHS Health Board Code
columns.description: Codes of 2019 NHS Health Boards

columns.name: hb2019name
columns.label: NHS Health Board Name
columns.description: Names of 2019 NHS Health Boards

columns.name: District
columns.label: Postcode District
columns.description: Outward code of their postcode (Area + Disrict)

columns.name: DataZone
columns.label: Data Zone
columns.description: Data Zone

columns.name: ur6_2016
columns.label: Urban/Rural classification
columns.description: Urban/Rural 6-fold classification (2016 classification)

columns.name: ur6_2016_name
columns.label: Urban/Rural classification name
columns.description: Urban/Rural 6-fold classification (2016 classification)

columns.name: simd2020v2_sc_quintile
columns.label: SIMD
columns.description: Scottish Index of Multiple Deprivation (calculated 2020, v2) Quintile Leave. Where 1 is the most deprived and 5 is the least deprived areas. This is based upon the LSOA (lower super output area) of the studies postcode.

columns.name: vacc_occurence_time
columns.label: Vaccine Occurence Time
columns.description: The date/time that the vaccine was administered. Note: see vacc_occurrence_date, as time is not currently saved in this file.

columns.name: vacc_dose_number
columns.label: Vaccine Dose Number
columns.description: The total number of doses (including booster) the study has now received after this dose i.e. the dose number.

columns.name: vacc_occurence_date
columns.label: Vaccine Occurrence Date
columns.description: The date that the vaccine was administered.

columns.name: vacc_product_name
columns.label: Vaccine Product Name
columns.description: The name of the vaccine (Pfizer/AstraZeneca/Moderna) that was administered.

columns.name: patient_sex
columns.label: Sex
columns.description: Sex at birth, determined from the vaccine record.

columns.name: patient_derived_post_code
columns.label: Postcode
columns.description: The postcode of the patient derived from the vaccine record (cannot be used!)

columns.name: patient_derived_health_board_code_9
columns.label: Health board areas
columns.description: The code for the Health Board in which the patient is a resident of(?).

columns.name: patient_derived_council_area_code_9
columns.label: Local Authority
columns.description: The code for the local authority the patient lives in (?) from the vaccine record

columns.name: patient_derived_health_board_name
columns.label: Health Board Name
columns.description: The name of the health board the patient is registered in (from the vaccine record)

columns.name: patient_derived_council_area_name
columns.label: Council Area Name
columns.description: The name of the council area the study is registered in (from the vaccine record).

columns.name: age
columns.label: Age
columns.description: Age in years (from the vaccine record)

columns.name: pub_age_group
columns.label: Age Group
columns.description: The age group of the individual e.g. 40-49

columns.name: mhra_age_group
columns.label: MHRA Age Group
columns.description: The age group determined by [MHRA](https://www.gov.uk/guidance/contact-mhra)

columns.name: care_home_staff
columns.label: Care Home Staff Flag
columns.description: A flag for if the study works in a care home or not (from the vaccine record)

columns.name: frontline_hscw
columns.label: Frontline Worker Flag
columns.description: Flag for if the study is a frontline healthcare worker (HCW)

columns.name: care_home_resident
columns.label: Care Home Resident Flag
columns.description: A flag for if the study is a care home resident at the time of vaccination. ! See `ch_resident` (?)

columns.name: shielding
columns.label: Shielding Flag
columns.description: A flag for if the study was shielding at the time of the vaccination.

columns.name: ch_resident
columns.label: Care Home Resident Flag (duplicate?)
columns.description: See`care_home_resident`

columns.name: hcw_cohort
columns.label: Health Care Worker Cohort Flag
columns.description: (?) Flag for if the study was in the health care workers cohort

columns.name: underlying_cond
columns.label: Flag for an underlying condition
columns.description: ?? the study has an underlying condition when the vaccine was administered?

columns.name: unpaid_carers
columns.label: Flag for unpaid Carers
columns.description: ?? The study was an upaid carer at time of the vaccine

columns.name: severely_immuno_supp
columns.label: Severely Immuno-suppressed Flag
columns.description: A flag for if the study is severly immuno-suppressed (see also `immuno_supp`)

columns.name: immuno_supp
columns.label: Immuno-suppressed Flag
columns.description: A flag for if the study is severly immuno-suppressed (see also `severely_immuno_supp`)

columns.name: vacc_booster
columns.label: Vaccine Booster Flag
columns.description: A flag for if this vaccine dose is a booster dose or not. Reliable (?)

columns.name: third_eligible_8wk
columns.description: ?? Eligible for a third in 8 weeks ??

columns.name: third_eligible_12wk
columns.description: ?? Eligible for a third in 12 weeks??

columns.name: first_dose
columns.label: First Dose Date
columns.description: Date of the first vaccine dose administered

columns.name: second_dose
columns.label: Second Dose Date
columns.description: Date the study received their second vaccine dose.

columns.name: third_dose
columns.label: Third Dose Date
columns.description: Date the study received their third vaccine dose.

columns.name: fourth_dose
columns.label: Fourth Dose Date
columns.description: Date the study received their fourth vaccine dose.

columns.name: fifth_dose
columns.label: Fifth Dose Date
columns.description: Date the study received their fifth vaccine dose.

columns.name: date_of_death
columns.label: Date of Death
columns.description: Date of death - reliable?

columns.name: validchi
columns.label: Valid CHI
columns.description: CHI number is valid when linking these datesets (will always be 1?)

columns.name: EAVE_LINKNO
columns.label: EAVE Study Identifier
columns.description: EAVE-II Identifier, pseudoynmised CHI numbers are used to create randomly assigned study index numbers.

columns.name: SubLab
columns.label: Sub lab
columns.description: Sub lab ID

columns.name: SequenceID
columns.label: Sequence ID Number
columns.description: Sequence ID number

columns.name: Collection_Date
columns.label: Collection date
columns.description: Date sample collected

columns.name: Sequencing_Date
columns.label: Sequencing date
columns.description: Date sample sequenced

columns.name: Alignment_Date
columns.label: Alignment date
columns.description: The date the sequence is first available to PHS for analysis (used for sample tracking and calculating turn around times)

columns.name: adm2
columns.label: County of patient
columns.description: County level based on patient's outer postcode

columns.name: HealthBoard
columns.label: NHS Health Board
columns.description: Name abbreviation of NHS Health Boards

columns.name: VariantofInterest
columns.label: Variant of interest
columns.description: whether VOC/VOI or not

columns.name: VariantShorthand
columns.label: Variance shorthand
columns.description: seems incomplete? - better to use lineage

columns.name: VariantCalling
columns.label: Variant calling
columns.description: Based on the PHE VUI/VOC genomic definition, there are thresholds within number of mutation / deletions present within your sequence that match the profile. HR-LQG is high risk low quality.

columns.name: ref_count
columns.label: Counts of reference bases
columns.description: Counts of reference bases (not mutations)

columns.name: alt_count
columns.label: Counts of mutations
columns.description: Counts of mutations (given that the mutation is an expected one within the VUI/VOC genomic profile)

columns.name: other_count
columns.label: Other counts
columns.description: Counts of bases that are not reference or expected mutations

columns.name: Ambiguous
columns.label: Counts of ambiguous bases
columns.description: Counts of bases which are ambiguous (typically due to low sequencing quality)

columns.description: EAVE-II Identifier, pseudoynmised CHI numbers are used to create randomly assigned study index numbers.

columns.name: LabSpecimenNo
columns.label: Number of laboratory specimen
columns.description: Number of laboratory specimen

columns.name: Sampledate_iso
columns.label: Sample Date
columns.description: The date the serology measurement was taken from the individual (in ISO format)

columns.name: year
columns.label: Year
columns.description: Year of the lookup file used to determine the Health Boards

columns.name: isoweek
columns.label: Week of Pandemic
columns.description: Week since the start of the pandemic

columns.name: sex
columns.label: Sex (number)
columns.description: Sex at birth, extracted by the serology team, it should not be trusted to be accurate

columns.name: age
columns.label: Age
columns.description: Age of the study given in years, extracted from the serology files - and shouldn't be well trusted

columns.name: healthboard
columns.label: Health Board
columns.description: The Scottish Health Board in which the individual was registered with.

columns.name: SpecimenOrigin
columns.label: Origin of specimen
columns.description: Where was the specimen taken. This is a primary care dataset, all values are 'Hospital'?

columns.name: DateCollected
columns.label: Date Collected
columns.description: The date that the specimen was collected from the origin (where it was taken)

columns.name: EcossDateReceived
columns.label: ECOSS Date
columns.description: The date in which the data was transfered into ECOSS

columns.name: SpecimenDate
columns.label: Specimen Date
columns.description: The date in whcih the specimen was tested by the assay for IgG levels (note: use `Sampledate_iso` for the date in which the blood specimen was extracted from the study

columns.name: SpecimenTypeRaw
columns.label: Specimen Type Raw
columns.description: Raw code for the specimen type (always STS as this is blood serum data)

columns.name: SpecimenType
columns.label: Specimen Type
columns.description: Always 'Serum' as this is serology dataset

columns.name: OrganismRaw
columns.label: Organism Raw
columns.description: Raw data of the test result from the assay

columns.name: Type
columns.label: Type
columns.description: Type of measurement (almost always IgG 2019-nCoV)

columns.name: OriginalOrganism
columns.label: Original organism
columns.description: Original organism - Coronavirus 2019 positive or negative

columns.name: test_result_qual
columns.label: Qualitative Test Result
columns.description: Qualitative test results from the assay for the presence (or lack thereof) of IgG to SARs-CoV-2. The assay defines the threshold that determines +ve or -ve tests.

columns.name: test_result_quant
columns.label: Quantative Test Result
columns.description: IgG measurements in Binding Activation Units [BAUs] that are measured by the assay. There are values that are truncated above/below certain values as the result was out-of-bounds of the assay's sensitivity for these.

columns.name: QNum
columns.label: Quantative Measumrent Value (Number)
columns.description: The raw quantative number value, removing truncated values (note: not so safe to use this as values below AND above the assay threshold have been set as NA

columns.name: Text
columns.label: Text
columns.description: Raw text output from the final report
